title: Justification - Representing Func as Power Series

content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, e raised to the 2 x power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is the Maclaurin series for <math alttext="f prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 plus x, plus, the fraction with numerator x squared, and denominator 2 factorial, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator x cubed, and denominator 3 factorial, end fraction, plus, dot dot dot, plus, the fraction with numerator x to the n power, and denominator n factorial, end fraction, plus, dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 plus 2 x, plus, the fraction with numerator 2 times x squared, and denominator 2 factorial, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator 2 times x cubed, and denominator 3 factorial, end fraction, plus, dot dot dot, plus, the fraction with numerator 2 times x to the n power, and denominator n factorial, end fraction, plus, dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 plus, 2 x, plus, the fraction with numerator open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 2 factorial, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, cubed, and denominator 3 factorial, end fraction, plus, dot dot dot, plus, the fraction with numerator open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, to the n power, and denominator n factorial, end fraction, plus, dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 plus, 2 times 2 x, plus, the fraction with numerator 2 times, open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 2 factorial, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator 2 times, open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, cubed, and denominator 3 factorial, end fraction, plus, dot dot dot, plus, the fraction with numerator 2 times, open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, to the n power, and denominator n factorial, end fraction, plus, dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 plus, 2 times 2 x, plus, the fraction with numerator 2 times, open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 2 factorial, end fraction, plus, the fraction with numerator 2 times, open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, cubed, and denominator 3 factorial, end fraction, plus, dot dot dot, plus, the fraction with numerator 2 times, open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, to the n power, and denominator n factorial, end fraction, plus, dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 10.15: (BC ONLY) Representing Functions as Power Series

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
